channel.title: Object coords
channel.description: Hmm, how do i make it, when you right click an object it gives the coords of it, i need it so i can delete doors n shit.

item.title: Object coords
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:292759”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=386812.msg2900284#msg2900284 date=1249464701]

No, because i stood next to the door, typed it in as deleteobject, but it didn’t work!
I want to be able to right click something and it comes up with the coords (But only if ur the owner = player rights 3)

ive done both sides, first thing ive done…

Anyway, i just remembered, shouldn’t it be deletewall?

Please help!

[/quote]
A doore would be classified as a wall. Just like the gates at PC. I did this kind of thing for pest control gates on my server. Just delete it for BOTH sides of the object. And it will make a sucessful deletion[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Object coords
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:5, topic:292759”]No, because i stood next to the door, typed it in as deleteobject, but it didn’t work!
I want to be able to right click something and it comes up with the coords (But only if ur the owner = player rights 3)

Please help![/quote]
A doore would be classified as a wall. Just like the gates at PC. I did this kind of thing for pest control gates on my server. Just delete it for BOTH sides of the object. And it will make a sucessful deletion

Read full topic

item.title: Object coords
item.dc:creator: @I_need_a_username I need a username
item.description:
@I_need_a_username wrote:

idk about Right clicking it, but if you Stand where it is, Type ::mypos
then go in client.Java er sumtin and look for “MakeGlobalObject” and search through that for the Coordinate of that door, then when you find it, Delete it, or type “//” infront of it if you Might want it later,
if its something like, A chair or something that you Cant walk where it is, Type ::noclip, or something like that, And do the same thing as above

Read full topic
